characterDescription:
The crier carried a writ with the king's words on it - bound between two cloth-covered boards - though she had the words of the writ memorized. To her annoyance, Kaladin alone had made her repeat the proclamation three times ... then yet again.
Idly, Kaladin thought that in any other battalion, its leader would be of a high enough social class to outrank her.
There would be dozens of women like her moving through the warcamp to read, and sometimes explain, Dalinar's words.
Her message was as follows:
